Universities and colleges -– Pennsylvania -– Greensburg -– Administration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The collection contains selected images from the UPG Archives of the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg and the Westmoreland County Historical Society. The images included are part of a larger collection of papers, artifacts, prints, slides, negatives, and videos documenting the history of the UPG campus. UPG was established in 1963.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: DVD 3A 2006, Oct. 11 (7th) Tokar, Dr. Franklin K. "A Magnet for Good Architecture: The Laurel Hill Highlands from Mason House to Fallingwater and Beyond." 7th annual Arthur St. Clair Lectureship, Oct. 11, 2006, Ferguson Theater. Dr. Franklin K. Tokar is a professor in the History of Art and Architecture Department at the University of Pittsburgh, Oakland Campus.

DVD3B 2007, Oct. 10 (8th) Mosher, Dr. Anne "Westmoreland's Downtown Heritage, From the Gilded Age to the Disney Era." 8th annual St. Clair Lectureship, October 10, 2007, Ferguson theater. Dr. Anne Mosher, Professor of Geography, Syracuse University.

DVD3C 2010, Oct. 6 (11th) Cannadine, Sir David "Andrew W. Mellon: Making Money & Giving It Away." 11th Annual St. Clair Lectureship, October 6, 2010. Ferguson Theater. Sir David Cannadine, British scholar, historian and author of Mellon: An American Life.

DVD3D 2011, Oct. 12 (12th) Nasaw, David, PhD "Making Sense of Making Millions". 12th Annual Arthur St. Clair Lectureship, October 12, 2011, Ferguson Theater. David Nasaw, PhD, author of the Pulitzer Prize for Biography finalist Andrew Carnegie and a distinguished professor of American History at Graduate Center of the City University of New York and director for the Humanities at the City University of New York. See also: RG52 Subject Files. Ser.: [Arthur] St. Clair Lectureship.
DVD3E Oct. 10, 2012 (13th) "Remembering the Battle of Bushy Run; Decisive Victory of Minor Skirmish" with Frank A. Cassell, PhD, 13th Annual St. Clair Lecture, Oct. 10, 2012. DVD 1 hr 30 min.

DVD3F 2013, Oct. 21 (14th) "Emancipating Lincoln: The Prose and Poetry of the Emancipation Proclamation" by Harold Holzer, the Metropolitan Museum of Art senior vice president for external affairs and a leading authority on Abraham Lincoln and the political culture of the Civil War era. 2 copies.

DVD3G 2014, Oct. 16 (15th) "Was the 'Whiskey Rebellion' Really About Whiskey?" by Terry Bouton, Assoc. Prof. of History, University of Maryland, Baltimore, MD where he is a Presidential Teaching Professor and an Organization of American Historians Distinguished Lecturer.
DVD3H 2015, Oct. 15 (16th) "Pennsylvania's Role in Presidential Politics -- Past and Present" by G. Terry Madonna, PhD, Prof. of Public Affairs, Franklin and Marshall College.
DVD3I 2016, Nov. 29 (17th) [lecture originally scheduled for Oct. 13] "Bouquets from the Cannon's Mouth: Soldiering with the Eighth Regiment of the Pennsylvania Reserve" by Robert E. Eberly, Jr., JD.
DVD3J 2019, Feb. 5 (18th) "Arthur S. Clair: Myth and History" by Susan Sommers, PhD.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Lynch Family Album. [v. 2, Houses in the Families and Other Points of Interest. 33 sheets 12" X 18" Color photocopy of an album of 140 photographs of the houses, residences, and estates of various members of the Lynch Family taken by Libby Schmidt, grandaughter of Commander Lynch and daughter of Judge Rial. Also includes photographs of other points of interest, i.e., Westmoreland Museum of Art, Blessed Sacrament Cathedral, the old [Greensburg] Library, the old [Greensburg] post office (now the Greensburg Library), Greensburg Central Catholic High School, First Presbyterian Church of Greensburg, First United Methodist Church, Christ Episcopal Church, Westmoreland County Courthouse, Royers Department Store, Troutman's Department Store, Barclay's Westmoreland Trust Co., First National Bank (now Southwest Bank), Coskey-Nicholson Funeral Home, Lynch Mausoleum, Keppel Funeral Home, St. Clair Cemetery (off Route 30), Westmoreland Polo & Hunt Club, Arthur St. Clair Park, Elks Club, YMCA, Greensburg Train Station, Penn Albert Hotel, Yancey's, Lynch Field, Roadman's Lake (State Run Road), Seton Hill College. This color photocopy made by Business Partners, Jeanette. Sent to the UPG Archives by the Office of the UPG President, Sept. 2, 2002. [Housed in Map Case. See: UPG.qRG.60 Prints. Lynch Family Album]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: UPG.RG.60.VC.I.3 Cassell, Dr. Frank A. Installation as Third President of the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg, March 25, 1998.

UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4 Oral History of the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg. Dr. Patricia M. Duck, Director of the Library, initiated the oral history project to document the history of the University of Pittsburgh at Greensburg in May, 1997. Dr. Mark D. McColloch conducted the interviews, except where noted, in sessions which each lasted between 60 and 90 minutes. The interview sessions were videotaped and since the project's inception in 1997, the following interviews have been conducted:
UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4h Pt. I, Pt. 2 Chambers, Dr. George Ferguson. Aug. 13, Oct. 11, 2002. 2 VC See also: UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.9
UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4a Chew, Dr. Paul. 1997, June 4. 1 VC See also: UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.4
UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4b McWhinney, Dr. Norman N. 1997, May 21. 1 VC See also: UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.2

UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4c Nicoletti, Dr. Guy M. 1997, May 28. 1 VC See also: UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.3 [n.b. UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4c found to be defective, 02/10/2020. Use UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.3] faz 02/11/2020
UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4d Poke, Dr. Carl F. 1997, June 18. 1 VC See also: UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.5
UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4e Reilly, Dr. Donald T. 1997, July 16. 1 VC UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.7
UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4g *Rossetti, Dr. Guy. 1998, July 20. 1 VC See also: UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.8
UPG.RG.60.VC.I.4f Scanlon, Dr. Norman W. 1997, June 25. 1 VC See also: UPG.RG.60.DVD.24.A.6 *Interview conducted by Dr. Patricia M. Duck

UPG.RG.60.VC.I.5 Segura, Prof. Juan. Interview with Prof. Juan Segura of Guanajuato, Mexico, first UPG Fullbright Scholar, Jan.-Apr., 2000. Interview conducted by Dr. Mark McColloch, Associate Vice President for Academic Affairs, on 19 April 2000. See also: UPG.RG.51 Biographical File -- Segura, Juan.

UPG.RG.60.VC.I.2 UPG Campus History. Interview with Mary Lynch Quinn, July 26, 1994. Gilfert M. Mihalich, Judge, Court of Common Pleas, Westmoreland County; Mike Rubinoff, Attorney and Associate Professor, UPG; Moderator, Robert Blum, Attorney.

Criminal Justice Day, March 25, 1993. 3 cassettes. scopecontent.p: Apt, Dr. Jay. "This View of Earth", a slide show from outer space, presented Sept. 7, 2000, UPG Ferguson Theater by Dr. Jay Apt, a former astronaut. VC VIII.4 Dr. Apt flew as a member of the crew of the Space Shuttle Atlantis (1991), was Endeavor's flight engineer (1992), flew again aboard Endeavor (1994) and served aboard Atlantis as it docked with the Russian Mir space station (1996).
